intro: Amphithalea parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved amphithalea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
